intro: Ochnella ndellensis, commonly known as the African mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences. Ochnella ndellensis is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in mountainous habitats.
